author: ajsutton
content: Are there any tools that can be used to convert an EIP2335 keystore from one form of encryption to another.  In particular from from `scrypt` which is very slow to decrypt to `pbkdf2` which is much, much faster.  `scrypt` is great for security so offline keystores should use it and it makes sense as a default, but it's not great for validator client keys because of how long it takes to decrypt (and how much memory it needs).

author: ajsutton
content: It sounded like something `ethdo` would be able to do but I can't see a way to import an EIP2335 keystore into it - I seem to need the decrypted private key and there aren't many tools that will decrypt and just print the secret key.

author: jgm
content: `ethdo` is undergoing a security audit at the moment, so I don't want to peturb the code too much, but I definitely want to be able to import EIP-2335 keystores and also allow selection of encryption algorithm.  The former I may be able to put in sooner, will take a look

author: ajsutton
content: From what I hear ethdo produces `pbkdf2` keystores (though I haven't actually found that option either... - my ethdo foo is weak) so if it can import there's a good chance it solves my issues well.
